results.headline: Going Back to His Old School, Where Ties Wind Up Binding
results.summary_short: In “Liberal Arts,” a college alumnus returns to his alma mater for the retirement dinner of a favorite professor and finds himself tangled in a nest of new relationships.

results.headline: High School Is Over, but the Angst Is Not
results.summary_short: In the high school reunion comedy “10 Years,” some old classmates are struggling to grow up.

results.headline: A Steely Fighter From the City That Care Forgot
results.summary_short: “I’m Carolyn Parker” is an account of a woman’s five-year effort to rebuild her house in the Lower Ninth Ward of New Orleans after Hurricane Katrina.
results.display_title: I'm Carolyn Parker: The Good, the Mad, and the Beautiful

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of I'm Carolyn Parker: The Good, the Mad, and the Beautiful

results.headline: Bonding With Pets, Not People
results.summary_short: Melissa Leo plays a granite-faced, taciturn woman who connects more easily with animals than with people.

results.headline: For Spy’s Family, a Bad Trip
results.summary_short: In “The Cold Light of Day,” directed by Mabrouk El Mechri, a vacation off the coast of Spain turns deadly for a C.I.A. officer, played by Bruce Willis, and his loved ones.

results.headline: A Marketing Man Fights the Madness
results.summary_short: Divine intervention leads an ad man in Moscow to turn against his industry and battle the corporate world.

results.headline: The Enduring Erotic Life Cycle of an Unpromising Relationship
results.summary_short: “Keep the Lights On,” by Ira Sachs, follows two men as their relationship grows, falters and endures over more than a decade.

results.headline: Far Beyond ‘Playhouse,’ Artist Remains Playful
